tweet_text: India has very few taxpayers per capita &a culture of tax evasion &black money. This must be the first time in history that Indian taxpayers who want to pay their taxes  are not able to pay because the IncomeTax portal is not working! Penalties should be imposed & heads roll.
text_en: India has very few taxpayers per capita &a culture of tax evasion &black money. This must be the first time in history that Indian taxpayers who want to pay their taxes are not able to pay because the IncomeTax portal is not working! Penalties should be imposed & heads roll.

tweet_text: The rationale for a new portal is to provide a more user-friendly, modern &seamless experience to users. However, even after spending ₹4200cr on its renovation, the Govt has failed to attain the objective & created a mess instead. This is a replay of the chaos w/the GST portal.
text_en: The rationale for a new portal is to provide a more user-friendly, modern &ampeamless experience to users. However, even after spending cr on its renovation, the Govt has failed to attain the objective & created a mess instead. This is a replay of the chaos w/the GST portal.

tweet_text:
1.   What was the need for a new IncomeTax portal when the old portal was running smoothly for years?
2.   Why was the Portal switched at peak time, when Income tax payers usually file their returns & claim refunds?
3.  Why was no testing of the new Portal done before its launch?
text_en: . What was the need for a new IncomeTax portal when the old portal was running smoothly for years?2. Why was the Portal switched at peak time, when Income tax payers usually file their returns & claim refunds?3. Why was no testing of the new Portal done before its launch?

tweet_text: Not clear why govt chose to change the income tax portal in June. Would have been wiser just before the end of the Financial Year or the start of the next one, so that taxpayers eligible for income-tax refund could have received help in these difficult times.
text_en: Not clear why govt chose to change the income tax portal in June. Would have been wiser just before the end of the Financial Year or the start of the next one, so that taxpayers eligible for income-tax refund could have received help in these difficult times.

tweet_text: But getting a notice from a UK-based organisation, citing @Twitter's role as a"service provider" under a US law, points to the challenges of @TwitterIndia's operations in India. @rsprasad has pointed to possible violations of Indian regulations while conforming to foreign rules.
text_en: But getting a notice from a UK-based organisation, citing 's role as a"service provider" under a US law, points to the challenges of 's operations in India. has pointed to possible violations of Indian regulations while conforming to foreign rules.
